SENT.plain: Antiphospholipid syndrome (APS) is defined as an autoimmune disorder characterized by recurrent thrombosis or obstetrical morbidity
A 29-year-old woman who was diagnosed with APS underwent emergency cesarean delivery at 23 weeks' gestation
She had a seizure attack and her laboratory findings were: AST/ALT 1459/1108 IU/L, LDH 1424 IU/L, 30% hematocrit, a platelet count of 43 Ã— 10(3)/ml and urine protein (4+)
We describe the anesthetic experience of catastrophic HELLP syndrome with antiphospholipid syndrome and we review the relevant literature
